issue.title: on AfterSend event blocks sendig the view
issue.body:
The on AfterSend event should run, after the view was send to the browser. But the browser seams to recieve the view after the AfterSend event is finish. It looks like the event behavior is lik "on BeforeSend", not "on AfterSend"

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Adding the following code block into the `web.php`
```
'components' => [
	    'response' => [
	        'class' => 'yii\web\Response',
			'on afterSend' => function ($event) {
                                sleep(10);
				Yii::debug('after send');
			},
         ]
```

### What is the expected result?
Ever request from an browser returned immediately. The user/browser received the view, after it is rendered, without 10 seconds delay. I expect, `sleep(10)` is not blocking the request.


### What do you get instead?
The request from the browser stops for 10 seconds. After the `afterSend`-sleep ist finish, the application sends the view/the brwoser receives the view. It looks like tihs event is working like an "on beforeSend" not like an "on afterSend".


### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.46
| PHP version      |  7.4.14
| Operating system | Yii2 docker container on ubuntu 20.04

issue.title: In the Safari browser, the default language for the documentation page is Arabic

labels.name: expired
labels.description: Information requested was not provided in two weeks.

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
- Opening the website (http://localhost:8080/) with the Safari browser
- Pressing the "Yii Documentation" button
- The documentation website opens, but it is in Arabic

- the result was the same in private Safari browser. 

### What is the expected result?
- We expected the documentation website to be in English as a default, because this was the case with Google Chrome, FireFox and Microsoft Edge

### What do you get instead?
- The default language was Arabic.


### Additional info

We are not sure if this was supposed to be this way, but seemed a bit odd, considering the default language was English with other browsers. 

The language can be changed to English or other languages. 


Yii version  2.0.

issue.title: Prevent trailing or duplicate spaces in class attribute

labels.name: pr:request for unit tests
labels.description: Unit tests are needed.

issue.body:
| Q | A | ------------- | --- | Is bugfix? | ❌ | New feature? | ✔️ | Breaks BC? | ❌ This is a tiny, backwards-compatible improvement to the `BaseHtml::renderTagAttributes` method. It removes empty elements from the classes array for the `class` attribute, preventing duplicate or trailing whitespaces in the generated HTML. ```php
[ 'my-custom-element', $someCondition ? 'my-custom-element--modifier' : null, ]]) ?>>
``` If `$someCondition` is false, this will result in the output: ```html
``` Notice the extra space at the end of the attribute. This is pretty common if you're using this function in Twig templates, where you can omit the last part of the ternary operator. By filtering out empty elements from the array of classes before joining it, you instead get this: ```html
``` Which is much nicer to look at.

issue.title: on AfterSend event blocks sendig the view
issue.body:
The on AfterSend event should run, after the view was send to the browser. But the browser seams to recieve the view after the AfterSend event is finish. It looks like the event behavior is lik "on BeforeSend", not "on AfterSend"

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Adding the following code block into the `web.php`
```
'components' => [
	    'response' => [
	        'class' => 'yii\web\Response',
			'on afterSend' => function ($event) {
                                sleep(10);
				Yii::debug('after send');
			},
         ]
```

### What is the expected result?
Ever request from an browser returned immediately. The user/browser received the view, after it is rendered, without 10 seconds delay. I expect, `sleep(10)` is not blocking the request.


### What do you get instead?
The request from the browser stops for 10 seconds. After the `afterSend`-sleep ist finish, the application sends the view/the brwoser receives the view. It looks like tihs event is working like an "on beforeSend" not like an "on afterSend".


### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.46
| PHP version      |  7.4.14
| Operating system | Yii2 docker container on ubuntu 20.04

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
- Opening the website (http://localhost:8080/) with the Safari browser

### Additional info

We are not sure if this was supposed to be this way, but seemed a bit odd, considering the default language was English with other browsers. 

The language can be changed to English or other languages. 


Yii version  2.0.

issue.title: Prevent trailing or duplicate spaces in class attribute

labels.name: pr:request for unit tests
labels.description: Unit tests are needed.

issue.body:
| Q | A | ------------- | --- | Is bugfix? | ❌ | New feature? | ✔️ | Breaks BC? | ❌ This is a tiny, backwards-compatible improvement to the `BaseHtml::renderTagAttributes` method. It removes empty elements from the classes array for the `class` attribute, preventing duplicate or trailing whitespaces in the generated HTML. ```php
[ 'my-custom-element', $someCondition ? 'my-custom-element--modifier' : null, ]]) ?>>
``` If `$someCondition` is false, this will result in the output: ```html
``` Notice the extra space at the end of the attribute. This is pretty common if you're using this function in Twig templates, where you can omit the last part of the ternary operator. By filtering out empty elements from the array of classes before joining it, you instead get this: ```html
``` Which is much nicer to look at.

issue.body:
<!--

-->
**NOTE: This problem happen when using rest Api.

### What is the expected result?

issue.title: In the Safari browser, the default language for the documentation page is Arabic
issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
- Opening the website (http://localhost:8080/) with the Safari browser
- Pressing the "Yii Documentation" button
- The documentation website opens, but it is in Arabic

- the result was the same in private Safari browser. 

### What is the expected result?
- We expected the documentation website to be in English as a default, because this was the case with Google Chrome, FireFox and Microsoft Edge

### What do you get instead?
- The default language was Arabic.


### Additional info

We are not sure if this was supposed to be this way, but seemed a bit odd, considering the default language was English with other browsers. 

The language can be changed to English or other languages. 


Yii version  2.0.

issue.title: on AfterSend event blocks sendig the view
issue.body:
The on AfterSend event should run, after the view was send to the browser. But the browser seams to recieve the view after the AfterSend event is finish. It looks like the event behavior is lik "on BeforeSend", not "on AfterSend"

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Adding the following code block into the `web.php`
```
'components' => [
	    'response' => [
	        'class' => 'yii\web\Response',
			'on afterSend' => function ($event) {
                                sleep(10);
				Yii::debug('after send');
			},
         ]
```

### What is the expected result?
Ever request from an browser returned immediately. The user/browser received the view, after it is rendered, without 10 seconds delay. I expect, `sleep(10)` is not blocking the request.


### What do you get instead?
The request from the browser stops for 10 seconds. After the `afterSend`-sleep ist finish, the application sends the view/the brwoser receives the view. It looks like tihs event is working like an "on beforeSend" not like an "on afterSend".


### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.46
| PHP version      |  7.4.14
| Operating system | Yii2 docker container on ubuntu 20.04

issue.title: Prevent trailing or duplicate spaces in class attribute

labels.name: pr:request for unit tests
labels.description: Unit tests are needed.

issue.body:
| Q | A | ------------- | --- | Is bugfix? | ❌ | New feature? | ✔️ | Breaks BC? | ❌ This is a tiny, backwards-compatible improvement to the `BaseHtml::renderTagAttributes` method. It removes empty elements from the classes array for the `class` attribute, preventing duplicate or trailing whitespaces in the generated HTML. ```php
[ 'my-custom-element', $someCondition ? 'my-custom-element--modifier' : null, ]]) ?>>
``` If `$someCondition` is false, this will result in the output: ```html
``` Notice the extra space at the end of the attribute. This is pretty common if you're using this function in Twig templates, where you can omit the last part of the ternary operator. By filtering out empty elements from the array of classes before joining it, you instead get this: ```html
``` Which is much nicer to look at.

issue.title: In the Safari browser, the default language for the documentation page is Arabic
issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
- Opening the website (http://localhost:8080/) with the Safari browser
- Pressing the "Yii Documentation" button
- The documentation website opens, but it is in Arabic

- the result was the same in private Safari browser. 

### What is the expected result?
- We expected the documentation website to be in English as a default, because this was the case with Google Chrome, FireFox and Microsoft Edge

### What do you get instead?
- The default language was Arabic.


### Additional info

We are not sure if this was supposed to be this way, but seemed a bit odd, considering the default language was English with other browsers. 

The language can be changed to English or other languages. 


Yii version  2.0.
